name: cement production, Portland | cement, Portland | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/363/documentation

The dataset describes the production of cement Portland (CEM I) in Switzerland and covers the representative production mix of CEM I 42.5 R and N as well as CEM I 52.5 R and N as defined in SN EN 197-1.;In Switzerland, according to the Swiss standard SN EN 197-1:2011, cement CEM I, also known as Portland cement, has 95-100% of clinker in its composition. 

The activity starts with the clinker in the silo to be used for cement production and with the additional ingredients of the cement at the gate of the cement plant. The dataset includes energy use, input of grinding aids and input of infrastructure.
 

The activity ends with the cement produced in the cement mill. The dataset does not include particulate emission, packaging and administration.
category: C:Manufacturing/23:Manufacture of other non-metallic mineral products/239:Manufacture of non-metallic mineral products n.e.c./2394:Manufacture of cement, lime and plaster

processDocumentation.timeDescription: Time period corresponds to data collection (2017-2021).
processDocumentation.geographyDescription: This dataset represents production of cement Portland (CEM I) for Switzerland.
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: In this dataset, the production of CEM I is described, where clinker (91.9%) is ground together with gypsum (4.99%) and mixed with limestone (0.98%). The activity includes also the input of electricity used for the grinding of the clinker and grinding aids (ethylene glycol and iron sulfate).
processDocumentation.samplingDescription: Data represents the average Swiss production of the 6 cement plants for the years 2017 to 2021 that were operational in 2021.

exchanges.description: Value provided by cemsuisse as an average from all cement producing plants in Switzerland.

exchanges.description:
Value provided by cemsuisse as an average from all cement producing plants in Switzerland.
This exchange has an activity link directly to the producing activity because the product is primarily consumed in the same geographical area where it is produced.
